tests.test_name: Client is unable to remove Processed Air tickets
tests.description: verify fix works - confirm that processed air tickets can now be deleted/rejected after reopening payroll and rejecting transaction
tests.what_to_test: Multi-step workflow: (1) Reopen closed payroll month, (2) Reject payroll transaction, (3) Verify air ticket request rejection/deletion options become available, (4) Confirm air ticket can be deleted

Assert transaction rejection option is available
Assert air ticket rejection/deletion buttons are enabled after transaction rejection
Assert air ticket is removed from system after deletion

assertions: Assert payroll period can be reopened
Assert processed transaction can be deleted
Assert request returns to pending state after transaction deletion
Assert request can be reassigned to different payroll period

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances. Users cannot automatically transfer unused ticket allowances between policy years, which limits flexibility in time-off management.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Customers must manually calculate total requests for multi-year policies (e.g., 5 requests/year × 5 years = 25 total requests). No automatic carry-over of unused balances between years. Requires careful upfront planning.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For multi-year policies, calculate total requests needed across entire cycle and set that as the total number of requests. For example, if 5 requests per year for 5 years, set total to 25 requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration — Multi-Year Cycles and Request Allocation

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently cannot notify or tag line managers about ticket processing when they are outside the standard approval flow. There is no automated notification system for proxy requesters or managers raising requests for employees.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers who submit air ticket requests on behalf of blue collar employees cannot receive notifications when tickets are processed. They have no visibility into completion status unless they are part of the formal approval workflow.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently, line managers must be added to the approval flow to receive notifications. Alternatively, HR can manually notify line managers outside the system when tickets are processed.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Request Notifications — Tracking Status for Proxy Requesters

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions. There are specific scenarios where employees cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot manage air ticket requests when: auto-encashment policy is inactive, hire date/probation end date is missing, they are not yet eligible for encashment, or they are in a policy other than auto-encashment. This creates confusion about eligibility status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure employee records are complete (hire date, probation end date) and verify policy assignment before attempting to manage air ticket encashment requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Auto-Encashment — Policy Eligibility and Employee Record Requirements

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat platform does not support a flexible document approval workflow that allows post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users cannot download letter requests, have them stamped externally, and re-upload the signed document. The system requires approval before download (to remove draft watermark), but approved requests cannot be modified or have attachments added. Approved requests cannot be returned to pending status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently, users must share documents via email for external stamping and attestation, then manually manage signed copies outside the system. No in-system workflow exists for this process.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Request Workflow — External Stamping and Document Re-upload Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks comprehensive employee visibility controls across HR modules. While some modules like Payroll and Work Expenses have partial employee grouping capabilities, the HR employee directory lacks granular access restriction functionality.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Organizations cannot restrict non-manager employees from viewing entire company employee profiles. Employee grouping is available on-demand for Payroll, Work Expenses, Loans, and Air Tickets modules, but not yet for HR modules including employee directory access.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For modules that support employee grouping (Payroll, Work Expenses, Loans, Air Tickets), create employee groups and map roles to specific groups to restrict visibility. For HR modules, no current workaround exists; contact support for custom development options.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Visibility and Access Control — Using Employee Groups and Structures

documentation_candidates.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks the capability to delete or reverse processed air ticket expense entries after they have been finalized. This prevents users from cleaning up test or erroneous data once an expense has been processed.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Once air tickets are processed, they cannot be deleted through the UI. Users cannot clean up test data or remove erroneous entries after processing. This creates permanent records that cannot be reversed.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Avoid processing test or dummy air tickets. If test data is processed, contact support for backend assistance. Ensure all air ticket entries are verified before processing.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Work Expenses — Air Ticket Management: Processed Expense Deletion Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks full role-based group restrictions, with grouping functionality limited to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups across HR and document modules.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Even after activating employee groups and restricting People Manager role to specific groups, the role can still view and edit employee details (work tab, documents) and see all adjustments for employees outside the assigned group. Grouping only restricts Air Tickets module, not HR or document modules.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently, employee grouping restrictions only apply to finance and payroll modules (Air Tickets, Adjustments). For HR module access control, use alternative permission management or contact support for custom solutions.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions — Module-Specific Limitations
